usa: John Glenn orbited the Earth.<sup id="cite_ref-341" class="reference">[341]</sup>
A decision was reached in Baker v. Carr which enabled federal courts to intervene in and to decide reapportionment cases.[342]
Three inmates go missing on an escape from Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary on June 11, 1962.<sup id="cite_ref-343" class="reference">[343]</sup>
A decision in Engel v. Vitale determined that it was unconstitutional for state officials to compose an official school prayer and require its recitation in public schools.[344]
Marilyn Monroe died of an apparent overdose from acute barbiturate poisoning at age thirty-six.<sup id="cite_ref-345" class="reference">[345]</sup>
Cuban missile crisis: A nuclear confrontation took place between the United States and the Soviet Union.[346]
